name: The Langham, HongKong

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed here twice in the last few weeks and I have been very impressed on both occasions. The service is excellent - everyone is extremely helpful and friendly. The hotel is well located and very well laid out. Both rooms were high quality and comfortable. There is a feeling about the place which makes me feel very welcome and comfortable and so I will definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Two great stays

reviews.text: Stayed at the Langham for 4 nights and thought it was very good value for money in Hong Kong. previously stayed at the Intercontinental, which, although a great hotel, was very expensive.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel, as other reviews have stated, is in a great location for Kowloon shopping, the MTR and easy access to the ferries, to get to Hong Kong island. Staff were attentive and live music most nights in the bar - great jazz, with a trio of singer, trumpet and piano. It would have been better if the music would have gone on past 11:45pm, as the atmosphere in the bar was just getting going most nights by then. Good cocktails.
reviews.title: Elegance
Very comfortable
reviews.text: I upgraded to the executive club package and got a nice executive suite with separate living room and access to the 11th floor lounge for free cocktails (certain hours), free breakfast and snacks in the afternoon.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was some traffic noise, but it did not bother us. Shower was super powerful - brilliant!
reviews.title: Quality hotel, excellent location

reviews.text: I was very disappointed with this hotel. May be it was because we had just experienced 2 weeks of outstanding service at hotels in Vietnam and Taipei, but the service at the Langham was lacklustre at best. The rooms are nothing special, small shower and bathroom and we found hairs in the bath. No morning newspaper. The poor service started when having been driven by our taxi driver to the Langham Place instead of the Langham through no fault of our own, as we told the driver several times which Langham we were staying at, the Langham place did nothing to assist. It would have been nice to have offered a hotel car to drive us to the correct hotel, only a 5 to 10 minute ride. When we finally checked in to the correct hotel, we were allocated a room on Floor 4 despite having requested a room on as high a floor as possible. So another 15 minutes wasted on shifting rooms when we were already running very late for a meeting with a friend.
reviews.title: Disappointing stay with non personal service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check in and check out very impersonal, as was service in the lobby bar. There is a lack of chairs in the lobby area, when waiting for a ride, nowhere to sit. A lot of people sitting in the lobby appeared to be visitors taking photos rather than hotel guests.
reviews.title: Perfectly located

reviews.text: To sum up, I will not stay at this hotel again.
reviews.title: Don't go for deluxe room if you want to stay at this hotel.
Simply Beautiful
reviews.text: The hotel is perfectly located at the heart of the shopping area in Hong Kong. Its right next to the harbour city mall which is probably the biggest mall in Hong kong. The room is alos nice and the hotel has quite a few good restaurant to dine as well. highly recommended.

This hotel looks grand at the lobby area. The deluxe room was quite normal to us as it doesn't appear luxury. It was quite disappointing. The staffs are very attentive n polite. The location is great as it is next to Harbour City shopping n Isquare too.
reviews.title: Perfect!
Excellent hotel,great location
reviews.text: Stayed at the Langham hotel for 5 nights at the end of november with my friend.We had a great time and found the hotel to have a brilliant location in Kowloon.It is near the ferry pier and also next to all the shops.It is a 5 star hotel and was worthy of this rating.The rooms were a decent size with comfortable beds and big bathrooms with large walk in showers.We were provided with complimentary water and slippers.They had all the christmas decorations up in the lobby which were really pretty aswell.Hotel itself was very clean and the staff were friendly.It had a lovely roof top pool which was small but seemed very adequate.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all,would highly recommend and thought it was really good value with a great location.
reviews.title: Impeccable service and beautiful rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Loved this hotel. Great location -- few blocks to the Star Ferry, near Jade market and luxurious shopping…. Make sure you upgrade to a renovated room -- with marble bathrooms, yummy bed sheets and beautiful wood. The Hotel service is impeccable. The staff is personable and professional. The pool is on the top floor, which is a great escape from a busy day of sightseeing and shopping. If you are tired of noodles...eat at their Main Street Deli located at street level. The Langham offers luxury at the right price. They welcomed us with champagne and chocolate-covered strawberries – all to celebrate our honeymoon. We are usually very demanding travelers (always looking for a great experience at the right price) – but we loved our stay and highly recommend this property.
reviews.title: Absolutely stay here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose to stay here for 6 nights because of the reviews on your website and it did not disappoint. We had a standard room that was quite large with a chair and a sofa. The bathroom had a separate shower and large tub. Service was prompt, elegant, and courteous. It is really well located near the Star Ferry and yet seems like a quiet oasis compared to the Peninsula and Marco Polo hotels that were noisy and too bustling.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfasts were fabulous and the dinner in the hotel's deli was excellent. It is also less than a block from the major designer mall with lots of restaurants and 2 supermarkets. We would absolutely stay here again when we return to Hong Kong.
reviews.title: best location, modern rooms, resonable price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arriving into Hong Kong late at night we took advantage of the limo service which was a great introduction to Hong Kong. Met at arrivals and taken to Limo check in desk to pick up drinks and be escorted to our car - with a nice personalised welcome letter. Smooth drive to the hotel. the hotel has a grand foyer and really a beautiful centre-piece. Afternoon tea is serviced here which is wonderful. Excellent way to start.
reviews.title: Elegant, understated and perfectly situated.
Amazing Hotel with impeccable service and luxury
reviews.text: Bit of a misunderstanding over smoking or non-smoking room booking (not sure there was an option on the internet) was resolved discreetly and efficiently and with a room upgraded and birthday wishes for my partner. We did take advantage of the complimentary paper which for some reason was never delivered, not once despite the efforts of all involved - a minor niggle that became a running joke.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was a lovely size with a beautiful big bathroom and a very nicely appointed. Wonderful bed and all the amenities you expect - big tv, bathrobes, turndown service etc and free wireless was included in out package and as members of the 1865 club.
reviews.title: Exceeded my expectations - just a wonderful experience

reviews.text: Breakfast is an amazing affair with a huge variety to choose from and live cooking stations. Exceptional food and service. There are a variety of high end eateries and a weekend midnight buffet too which we didnt get to experience this time round.
reviews.title: Great hotel, very welcoming

reviews.text: We ate at the main st. deli which is very popular (book if you can and as a resident of the hotel you get a discount). It was my partners' birthday so a table was found. We had fantastic hospitality from Crystal who made a fuss and ensured a birthday candle was presented with dessert and a round of happy birthday - a lovely touch. She is a fantastic hardworking host who is a great asset.
reviews.title: Perfect, amazing food, palatial and respectful

reviews.text: I have stayed in this hotel many times and found the staff to be extremely attentive. The Customer Service Manager (Glenn) is very helpful and considerate and I think that there are many loyal customers to this place.
reviews.title: A very nice hotel

likes.disliked: — rooms are getting old now and need of a freshen up

reviews.text: This stay, like so many others, involved a nice room and a good breakfast (almost too much choice), however they are now in need of a little refurbishment and polishing - but are always clean and very spacious for Hong Kong.
reviews.title: Fair

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unlike an earlier review I have always found the concierge staff to be fabulous....but then I guess it is how you treat / speak to people that determines reactions. I can't get too excited about newspapers to be honest.
reviews.title: Very nice

reviews.text: The pool and gym are small but I never plan to spend too long in them!
reviews.title: good experience at the Langham
Great location for shopping
reviews.text: First the location, it is just a hop across the street to Harbour City among other malls around including attached DFS to the hotel. The hotel is classic in style with many signature pink accents all around.
Checkin was swift and easy, we got the double Grand Room which allows us access to Club Lounge with breakfast, afternoon tea and evening drinks.
reviews.title: BEST service & location

reviews.text: Room is quite new in facility, spacious and comfy beds. The amenities is as expected of 5 star hotel.
reviews.title: European elegance in the heart of Tsim Sha Tsui

reviews.text: Concierge is quite friendly and accommodating with my back and forth questions.
reviews.title: Very nice location for shopping!

reviews.text: I didn't get to try the restaurants at the hotel.
reviews.title: Fantastic Charm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed a couple of nights in the Langham on a stopover to celebrate my husbands birthday. He was craving yum cha so we jut knew it had to be Hong Kong for a crazy 2 days of eating, drinking and shopping! Now while the Langham doesn't look that much from the outside once you step aside the beautiful aroma (white ginger???) instantly makes you feel relaxed. We arrived at stupid time in the morning but were checked in straight away. The lovely man who checked us in escorted us up to our room and gave us a complete run down of the room which was fab. I like this because, well, as I get older I'll be damned if I can find light switches in hotel rooms these days. I'll be lying in bed trying to turn off desk lamps, room lights, floor lamps, bathroom lights, hall lights and tracking them all down is like 20mins. So thank you my friend. Also hooked us up with wifi. I should say Club rooms, totally worth it for breakfast and cocktails. Up for a swim to help with jet lag and pleasantly surprised, a really beautiful area, so rare in HK. Now we didn't mention my husbands birthday to any of the staff, but one eagle eyed front desk person must have noticed on the passport becuase when we returned from our big night out, the most gorgeous cake and card was waiting for us. Who doesn't like cheesecake 2 int he morning! It was a really nice touch thank you. The location is excellent, for those who like jazz nearby is Ned Kellys Last Stand which has good jazz each night and yum cha freaks right near the hotel is probably the best soup dumpings weve ever eaten at the famous Din Tai Fung. The airport bus stops right outside front of the hotel. We've stayed in Auckland & Melbourne Langhams and I really enjoy these hotels for a step back in time, the good ole days of travel, everything is gilt in gold, service is friendly and not rushed, rooms aren't filled with techno gizmos, furniture is plush and comfy. It's simple but done really well, thank you Langham HK for a great birthday weekend.
reviews.title: Defines service & old world glamour

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 5 nights in mid September in the Grand Langham room at the Langham Hotel.
reviews.title: A beautiful hotel perfectly situated

reviews.text: The room was excellent, service excellent and the staff very friendly, professional and attentive. The location is perfect for shopping, the subway, ferries etc. Restaurants within the hotel we dined in were the L'Eclipse buffet one evening and for breakfast and the Bostonian which we highly recommend for an excellent steak. Would highly recommend this hotel. We could find no negatives to tell of.
reviews.title: Excellent stopover hotel

reviews.text: The Langham Hong Kong is conveniently located to allow visitors to experience both Hong Kong Island and Kowloon. Plenty of good restaurants nearby and for those who like to shop everything is in walking distance. The metro and ferry services to Hong Kong Island and Macau are also close by. Hotel is what you would expect from Langham.
reviews.title: Wonderful service at the Langham Hotel

reviews.text: My husband and I recently stayed at the Langham on the way to Paris. We had such an enjoyable time that we interrupted our flight home specifically to stay at the Langham again. Everything about the hotel was perfect. The attention to small details was impressive and the staff were absolutely charming. We felt it was an outstanding experience and would particularly recommend the Langham Club for the extra care that is provided by the staff to all members.
reviews.title: Absolutely sensational

reviews.text: My daughter and I stayed at the Langham Hong Kong for 5 nights - best decision! Really lovely hotel, fantastic service and so convenient. Room was good size with lovely bathroom and quiet room. We were on the 7th floor. The breakfast was good and they catered for my daughter's gluten free diet.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.text: From arrival to departure, the service we received at The Langham was outstanding. We were running a conference at the hotel. It can be stressful work but Angel, Edith and their team made it a pleasure.
reviews.title: Superb hotel, excellent service and great conference facilities

reviews.text: There was always someone on hand to help and go above and beyond the norm in ensuring we could service our conference guests perfectly.
reviews.title: As Remembered

reviews.text: The hotel has great facilities with the bedrooms containing very comfortable beds and despite being right in the centre of the main shopping area, it was still quiet. The hotel pool was a nice place to relax after a hard day's work. We will definitely be back and would highly recommend the hotel to others - for business or leisure
reviews.title: Good old Langham

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Me and my mum were in Hong Kong for a few days before flying to Bangkok to meet my sister who has been travelling for the past five months. When we were deciding on where to stay, we both instantly wanted to stay at the Langham. We stayed here four years ago and we all loved it. From the moment we entered the lobby of the Langham, we could smell the distinct Langham Fragrance. The lobby is the same as we remembered with the beautiful decor, smell and the large bouquet of flowers in the centre. We arrived at the hotel earlier than expected and therefore our room was not ready. We were booked into the Grand Langham Room - however we were interested in upgrading to a club room so we could have access to the Club Lounge. We ended up upgrading ourselves to The Langham Club and our room was upgraded to the Langham Club Room free of charge. Although it was expensive to upgrade - it was well worth the cost. When staying in a Club Room, you get access to the Club Lounge which is located on the 11th Floor of the Hotel. The lounge is the perfect place to get away from the crowds in Hong Kong and also the perfect place to relax after a long day of shopping or sightseeing in Hong Kong. The best thing about having access to the Club Lounge is the complimentary drinks included in the package. You can have unlimited drinks which included champagne, spirits, beers and soft drinks. You also get to have afternoon tea up in the Lounge as many times as you want. There are also different foods up there from crisps too hot and cold snacks which included sandwiches, quiche, meats and pastries. As well as having afternoon tea in the Lounge, you can also have breakfast up there which I must say is better in the lounge than downstairs in L'ECLIPSE as it is less busy, more relaxing and the food is better as there is more choice. There is also a business centre in the Club Lounge which has computers and printers which meant we could check in online for our flight and print our boarding cards out. Now onto the Langham Club Room. This room was spacious with a lot of storage space for clothes and electronics. There are also a LOT of plugs for you to charge your phones, laptops and tablets. The beds and pillows were AMAZING - we had two beds in out room which were very big and very comfortable. We like rooms that have good blinds or curtains and this room definitely had those. The curtains were great as they were black out which meant it was completely dark in the room even though it was sunny and bright outside.The only thing about the Club Room which we were unsure of was they had apparently been renovated recently yet they did not look newly decorated. The pool located on the roof was lovely and quiet. It was great to go for a relaxing swim after a long day out and then sit down on one of the multiple loungers next the pool. The gym also looked great - perfect if you are a gym fanatic and like to keep fit while on holiday. Our overall experience of the Langham has been wonderful. It is a luxurious hotel but expensive. The Langham Club Lounge was fantastic and well worth the cost. We would definitely stay here again!!
reviews.title: Lovely to be back

reviews.text: I stayed at the Langham Kowloon at Tsim Sha Tsui for 4 nights in September. I booked an Executive Suite, but was unexpectedly upgraded to the Penthouse Suite on the 15th Floor!
reviews.title: Old style elegance but getting a bit tired and dated ...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel location is probably its strongest point. You are literally in the center of the heart of Kowloon. All the major shops are within walking distance.
reviews.title: Ok, but not quite "it".

reviews.text: As stated by many reviewers, the hotel entrance is quite spectacular - done in a rather elegant European style. The signature scent is unmistakably Langham. Check-in was very efficient. Reception and concierge staff were very courteous, responsive and efficient.
reviews.title: Everywhere in HK is downtown and expensive, so this may be as good as you can get for the money.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel looks old and is old. So beware. If you are hoping to stay in a more modern facility, you should choose another hotel such as some of the more newly renovated ones in Kowloon or HK Island or some of the newly built ones such as ICON or the Mira. This Langham is probably one of the oldest hotels in Kowloon, though the maintenance has been quite commendable. However, there are some obvious signs of ageing and "wear and tear".
reviews.title: Excellent stay

reviews.text: The Suite was big - separate bedroom, living room and a dining room. The bathroom was surprisingly very small and quite cramped, due to the rather large Jacuzzi bath tub, which I felt was unnecessary. Overall, the Suite was well maintained, but there are obvious signs of "wear and tear". Housekeeping was responsive and of a high standard.
reviews.title: A pink paradise in the city

reviews.text: What a fantastic hotel, we felt looked after from when we made our booking to the time that we left. The staff were all amazing, they helped with every request and helped to make it one unforgettable holiday!
reviews.title: Probably the best hotel we have stayed in!

reviews.text: The room was very clean and spacious, and the bed very comfortable with plenty of storage and seating.
reviews.title: Great stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We returned to our room after our first day out to find a bottle of wine and a tray of petit fours, fruit etc with a note welcoming us to The Langham and Hong Kong, a very very nice touch and very warmly received!!
reviews.title: In The cradle of luxury
A brilliant and memorable stay!
reviews.text: We tried the Main Street Deli restaurant which is in the hotel, they have amazing American style sandwiches and cheesecakes and you also get 20% off your bill if you are staying in the hotel.

reviews.title: Holiday
reviews.text: The breakfast pastries were really good and I was addicted to the blueberry pastries for the duration of my stay!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful, luxurious hotel. deserves every great review it gets & its place as the only Hong Kong Hotel in "Leading hotels of the world". Fabulous refurbished rooms with luxury marble bathrooms, great lighting, all the high tech stuff you could want. Great staff on reception, happy to help with sightseeing advice, & uniformed porters to open the doors, park cars etc. Everyone so friendly & able to make every guest seem special. Wonderful bar with excellent singer & pianist & superb service. Only a shame that some guests don't see fit to dress for the occasion, but they don't mind if you are a bit scruffy, just doesn't seem right in this atmosphere somehow.
reviews.title: Langham - better than 5 star!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wonderful breakfasts & lovely restauraunts. A great location near to the Star Ferry Terminal, designer shops & the fabulous 29th floor restaurant opposite. Also not far from botanical gardens & some quainter old streets which are the last remaining parts of "old" Hong Kong. - easy walk to these.
reviews.title: Really nice Grand Langham Room!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've stayed in many hotels but this one really had the "wow" factor for me! I couldn't fault it. Despite its very central location in Kowloon it wasn't noisy, it was like a little oasis of peace from the bustle around. I wouldn't stay anywhere else in Hong Kong!
reviews.title: Excellent stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at one of their brand new grand langham rooms from dec 26 to 28. Rates were cheaper then (HKD 2500 per night + tax) because of the promo period. Very, very nice room but on the small side. Concierge was very helpful in making restaurant recommendations and reservations. Location is fantastic as it is right on Peking Road with all the designer boutiques as well as the Harbour City shopping center just a few steps away.
reviews.title: Langham Hotel TST

likes.liked: — The high quality and spaciousness of our room,(328 sq ft). Michelle the maid for 13th floor was absolutely wonderful

reviews.text: Staff friendly, rooms very clean - arrived to be told 'we will upgrade you' excellent news - breakfast excellent - service thoughout couldnt be faulted. Credit to staff.
reviews.title: A good stay, overall

reviews.text: 1st time we stayed at langham was in dec 2003 - wasn't sure about it since we've always stayed at a different hotel (couldn't stay there since it was fully booked). it was actually a good thing - LOVE the hotel. excellent rooms, great staff, love the location. after that first stay, we've never switched hotels. i highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: love it and will continue to stay here

likes.liked: — location and cleanliness of the entire hotel

reviews.text: I traveled solo to HKG for 4 nights, booked a room on the Club Floor, and was thrilled with my upgrade to a spacious suite. The Langham has the elegance of a fine British hotel (sister property in London), with the Asian service that you would expect in Hong Kong. My LR suite was fairly simple with couch, desk, and flat screen TV. Bedroom was decent sized, and the bathroom was wonderful with large shower and jacuzzi tub.
reviews.title: Lovely Langham!

reviews.text: I called to request a converter for my camera charger, and they brought it up with 2 minutes AND plugged it in for me--something I'm not accustomed to. I loved the attentive Asian hospitality.
reviews.title: Fantastic Little Jewel

reviews.text: The Club Floor was terrific--nice breakfast, hot appetizers and wine for evening happy hour (4-8pm?), newspapers, free internet on the 2 PC's, and really nice staff. The main street below my room gets a lot of bus traffic which can be noisy on weekdays, although the rooms are insulated so it wasn't bad.
reviews.title: Uncomfortable stay

likes.liked: — The fact that things got from bad to worse to even worse
likes.disliked: — Can I have a bigger box?

reviews.text: Langham is a United Mileage Plus partner, so I even got 2,000 miles for my stay.
reviews.title: This is a great hotel with excellent service! We just had to write about it!

description: Pre-eminent among Hong Kong hotels, The Langham Hong Kong presents a refined European-style haven in the heart of the bustling Tsimshatsui shopping and tourism district.With gracious charm and polished five star luxury, Langham Hotel Hong Kong is the only Hong Kong hotel that can claim the legendary heritage of the original grand hotel.Here is what you desire in a Hong Kong hotel...enchantingly opulent surroundings, innovative amenities and bespoke service that anticipates your every whim.
